page.title: 05BRECON MOUNTAIN RAILWAY
page.content: MR. Hills has owned the railway for seven years, the present day railway was constructed in the late 1970's and started operating in 1980 but the original railway was built in 1863 and ran from Brecon to Merthyr.The track today is two miles long but they are planning to extend it another three and a half miles to Torpantau.At present to travel the full length of the two and a half mile track from Pant to Pontsticill and back,it costs adults Â£1:80,senior citzens Â£1:20,children Â£0:90,dogs Â£0:25 and children under five travel free.On average the railway carries 35,000 passengers a year.They employ seven people full time and extra four in the summer.
